Mi Watch, the new connected watch from Xiaomi.
06 Nov 2019, 16:16 by David Peruch
The Chinese manufacturer has unveiled its new connected watch, the Mi Watch. A model that must be recognized is, so to speak, a complete clone of the Apple Watch.
So, if the rumors had been running for a few days on this watch connected to the Chinese manufacturer, it is now well founded. Indeed, the manufacturer has unveiled, its connected watch that we admit is a clone of the connected watch from Apple.
This is not the first time that Xiaomi offers products that is similar to those of Apple, but this Mi Watch ... We could almost believe that it is the same chain assembly. Note that this may well be the case üòâ
What is this Mi Watch made of?
So what about this new connected watch "made in China". The watch is equipped with a rectangular body and a 1.78 inch AMOLED display (curved along the edges). Its chassis is in matt aluminum.
At the heart of the watch, there is a Snapdragon Wear 3100 processor. As for the onboard memory, it is 1 GB of RAM. For storage the watch is entitled to 8 GB.
The manufacturer also announces a 36-hour battery life with LTE connectivity. Autonomy made possible thanks to its 570mAh battery.

Connectivity at the top for the Mi Watch.
Indeed, as mentioned above, the watch is equipped with a 4G LTE modem to work and stay connected to the world as your smartphone. Also note that the watch is equipped with Wi-Fi 802.11b / g / n and Bluetooth 4.2. No double band for the watch when it comes to Wi-Fi.
As for the embedded operating system, it is an adapted version of WearOS. The watch will also be able to track your physical activity and your heart rate. It has a GPS.
